H0.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Modulated

H1.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Shifted

H2.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Altered

H3.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. transposed

A4.text: In sonata form, a modulation separates the first subject from the second subject.

A5.text: Changes of key may also represent changes in mood.

A6.text: A piece of music which is primarily written in one key may transition, or modulate, to another.

A7.text: Music written in one key can be converted to another, or transposed, by raising or lowering each pitch by the same number of semitones.
